title: Islamic Nato? Why Saudi-Pak defence pact changes everything - for India and Israel
content: Saudi Arabia and Pakistan have solidified their alliance with a strategic mutual defense agreement, treating an attack on one as an attack on both. This pact, signed amidst regional tensions following an Israeli airstrike in Doha, signals a shift in Saudi Arabia's reliance on US security guarantees.

title: Iran's Chabahar Port in trouble: US revokes sanctions exemption; big impact on India
content: The US revocation of sanctions exemptions for Chabahar Port poses challenges to India's regional connectivity plans. This move threatens Indian investments and operations, complicating its strategic balance between the US and Iran. The port is vital for trade with Afghanistan and Central Asia, serving as a counterweight to China's influence.

title: 'We want Bagram back': Trump says US will reclaim Afghan airbase; targets China
content: Donald Trump announced plans to "get back" Bagram Airbase in Afghanistan, citing China's growing influence. Trump emphasized the base's strategic value due to its proximity to China's nuclear facilities, only an hour away. Bagram, a key US military asset for two decades, allowed power projection across South and Central Asia.

title: Young sensation! Injuries to breakthrough: Sachin Yadav’s javelin career hits new peak
content: Sachin Yadav, a World Athletics Championships debutant, stunned with a personal best of 86.27m in the men's javelin final in Tokyo, securing fourth place. Yadav outshone seasoned athletes, including Olympic champion Arshad Nadeem and compatriot Neeraj Chopra. His impressive throw kept him in medal contention, marking a significant milestone in his career after overcoming past injuries and setbacks.

title: US citizenship process update: USCIS unveils new test; applicants face stricter rules
content: USCIS is set to implement a new naturalization civics test in 2025, aiming to assess immigrants' understanding of US history and government. This is part of an effort to reinforce the integrity of the naturalization process. Stricter rules, including tougher reviews and neighborhood investigations, are also being rolled out to ensure eligibility and good moral character.

title: Albania AI minister: Virtual avatar 'Diella' delivers first speech in parliament
content: Albania has unveiled Diella, its pioneering AI 'minister,' to parliament, championed by Prime Minister Edi Rama as a symbol of transparency and innovation. Dressed in traditional attire, Diella aims to combat corruption in public spending.

title: Revealed! The hidden injury that shattered Neeraj Chopra's medal dream
content: Neeraj Chopra, battling a back injury sustained during training in the Czech Republic, finished a disappointing eighth at the World Championships final in Tokyo. The injury, which occurred on September 4th, hampered his training and affected his performance. Despite the setback, compatriot Sachin Yadav impressed, securing fourth place with a personal best, highlighting India's growing strength in javelin.

title: Tech Prosperity Deal: Trump’s funny moment with Nvidia CEO; signs AI pact with UK PM
content: During a state visit to Britain, President Trump acknowledged AI's growing influence while signing a "Tech Prosperity Deal" with Prime Minister Starmer. The agreement aims to enhance US-UK collaboration in AI, quantum computing, and nuclear projects. Tech giants like Nvidia, Google, and Microsoft pledged billions in UK investments, with Nvidia's CEO forecasting Britain's rise as an AI superpower.

title: Rahul vs EC Round 2: Cong's new attack fact-checked by EC; BJP mocks claims
content: Rahul Gandhi has accused the Chief Election Commissioner of shielding “vote chors” and obstructing investigations into voter deletions, presenting alleged proof of manipulation in Karnataka's Aland constituency. The BJP has dismissed these claims as lies, while the Election Commission has refuted them, stating that deletions cannot be done online.

title: India-US trade war: Trump may cut 25% penalty tariff soon - what CEA said
content: Chief Economic Advisor anticipates the resolution of the tariff dispute between India and the United States by the end of November, expecting a reduction in tariffs. India's economy continues its growth trajectory, with a projected second-quarter GDP growth of around 7%.

title: Indian-origin detained by ICE: Payphone case unfolds; who is Paramjit Singh
content: Paramjit Singh, an Indian-origin businessman and green card holder for 30 years, has been detained by ICE at Chicago O'Hare Airport after returning from India. The detention stems from a decades-old incident involving a pay phone.

title: US Fed rate cut: How does it impact mortgages, credit card interest? Explained
content: The US Federal Reserve has cut interest rates for the first time in nine months, reducing the short-term rate to around 4.1%. This decision, influenced by slow progress on inflation and a weakening job market, aims to address the dual challenge of high prices and difficult employment conditions.

title: Neeraj Chopra rips off belt; covers face after final elimination - watch
content: Neeraj Chopra finished eighth in the men's javelin throw final at the World Athletics Championships. His best throw was 84.03m. Keshorn Walcott of Trinidad and Tobago won gold. Anderson Peters secured silver, and Curtis Thompson took bronze. Sachin Yadav of India finished fourth with a personal best. Arshad Nadeem of Pakistan ended in tenth place.

title: Report: Taylor Swift distressed by Kelce’s reaction to Chiefs loss
content: Taylor Swift is reportedly concerned about the intense public scrutiny affecting her fiancé, Travis Kelce. During a recent NFL game, Kelce's on-field frustration became headline news after he dropped a crucial pass. Sources reveal that the pressure of being linked to Swift has magnified every move Kelce makes, leading to unprecedented levels of attention.

title: Luka Doncic: 'I don't think so,' no plans to follow LeBron
content: LeBron James gears up for his 23rd NBA season with the Los Angeles Lakers, joined by Luka Doncic, who's entering his 8th season. While James aims for another championship, potentially his last, Doncic clarifies he doesn't plan to play as long as his veteran teammate.

title: Kuldeep Yadav on facing Pakistan: 'It's just a batter in front of you'
content: Team India has secured its spot in the Asia Cup 2025 Super Four after defeating UAE and Pakistan. The India-Pakistan match was marred by a handshake controversy. Spinner Kuldeep Yadav, unfazed by the off-field drama, is focused on the upcoming matches. He emphasized his good rhythm and the favorable conditions for spinners.

title: Air India crash: Victims' kin sue Boeing, Honeywell; blame fuel cutoff switches
content: Families of Air India Flight AI171 crash victims are suing Boeing and Honeywell, alleging faulty fuel switches caused the disaster. The lawsuit claims the switches' design led to accidental activation, cutting engine power shortly after takeoff. Despite meeting regulatory requirements, the switches' placement is questioned, though experts deem accidental activation unlikely.

title: Will Tua Tagovailoa play? -Dolphins QB injury update — facing Bills tonight
content: Tua Tagovailoa will suit up for the Miami Dolphins against the Buffalo Bills on Thursday Night Football. Despite a rough 0-2 start and questions about his form, the Dolphins QB takes the field in Week 3. Here’s the latest on his status, game details, and what it means for Miami’s season.

title: Elon Musk outlines Mars colony plan: Starship key; settlement by 2055
content: Elon Musk envisions a self-sustaining Mars settlement within 30 years, hinging on SpaceX's Starship and its heavy-lift capabilities. Success depends on increasing cargo tonnage per launch window, enabling settlers to establish independent infrastructure. Overcoming Starship's reusability challenges, particularly the heat shield, is crucial for cost-effective colonization and achieving planetary redundancy.

title: Online gaming regulation: New rules to take effect from October 1
content: New online gaming regulations are set to be implemented from October 1st, according to Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw. The government has engaged in extensive discussions with stakeholders, including gaming companies and banks, to finalize the rules. The legislation aims to promote e-sports while banning harmful money-based gaming and associated financial activities, with penalties targeting providers and promoters rather than players.

title: Who is Sachin Yadav? Indian javelin throw star who outshone Neeraj Chopra
content: Sachin Yadav, the Indian javelin thrower, made a significant impact at the World Athletics Championships 2025 in Tokyo, securing fourth place with a personal best of 86.27 metres. He surpassed expectations by outperforming prominent Asian competitors Neeraj Chopra and Arshad Nadeem.

title: Jimmy Kimmel 'cancelled' - comical or tragic?
content: Today, Trump and MAGA sing the same hymn. The very people who raged against cancel culture now practise it with missionary zeal. Academics, nurses, and journalists who mocked Kirk’s death have been punished into silence. The chorus hasn’t changed — only the choir.

title: ‘Beaten to death with baseball bat’: Inside the grisly murder of 71-year-old NRI
content: In a shocking incident near Ludhiana, NRI Rupinder Kaur was allegedly murdered by Sukhjit Singh, at the behest of Charanjit Singh, residing in UK. Rupinder was killed to prevent her from filing a case against Charanjit after he backed out of marriage. Sukhjit allegedly bludgeoned her, burnt the body, and disposed of the remains in a canal.

title: Exclusive | Handshake row: PCB's emails to ICC, closed door meeting & Pycroft's non apology
content: Amidst uncertainty surrounding Pakistan's Asia Cup participation, the PCB demanded match referee Andy Pycroft's removal, alleging code of conduct violations during the India-Pakistan match, specifically regarding the captains not shaking hands. Despite PCB's threats, the ICC stood firm, asserting Pycroft followed ACC instructions and didn't violate any rules.

title: Mumbai’s Metro Line 3: Seamless underground transit for commuters
content: Mumbai's Metro Line 3 will inaugurate on September 30. Travel time between South Mumbai and T2 airport will reduce to 45 minutes. The Cuffe Parade-Aarey stretch will cost Rs 70 and take 54 minutes. This underground metro aims to ease road congestion. Kalbadevi and Girgaon stations are now ready after initial delays.

title: Rep Comer calls CEOs: Discord, Reddit, Twitch, Steam — radicalization probe
content: James Comer will investigate online platforms' role in radicalization. He has summoned CEOs of Discord, Reddit, Twitch, and Steam to testify. The hearing is scheduled for October 8, 2025. It follows Charlie Kirk's assassination, possibly linked to online forums. Comer aims to prevent platforms' exploitation for extremist purposes. The committee will identify warning signs and business models facilitating harmful behavior.

title: 'Stop giving excuses': Rahul on EC's fact-check; targets CEC Gyanesh Kumar
content: Rahul Gandhi has intensified his criticism of Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar, alleging obstruction of the investigation into vote fraud in the Aland assembly constituency. Gandhi claims the CEC blocked the FIR and CID investigation, potentially impacting the 2023 election results. The Election Commission has refuted Gandhi's claims, dismissing the allegations of massive vote deletion as baseless and incorrect.

title: Lamine Yamal’s love life: Nicki Nicole moments go viral — fans react
content: Footballer Lamine Yamal and singer Nicki Nicole are now a couple. They shared their love story on social media. Fans are very happy to see them together. Nicki is learning Catalan from Lamine. They are spending time together in Barcelona and Monaco. Lamine is a rising star in football. Nicki is a global music icon from Argentina.

title: US citizenship test hardens: Guideline for India H-1B holders; what to prepare
content: Indian H-1B visa holders aiming for US green cards now face tougher hurdles as the US reinstates a stricter citizenship test from October 2025. Applicants must answer 12 of 20 civics questions from a 128-question pool, alongside heightened background checks. For Indians, the second-largest immigrant group in America, preparation and awareness are key to navigating these evolving immigration rules.

title: World Athletics Championships: Neeraj Chopra finishes 8th in javelin throw final; Sachin Yadav 4th
content: Neeraj Chopra's quest for another World Athletics Championships medal fell short as he finished eighth in the men's javelin final, a stark contrast to his previous triumph at the same venue. Keshorn Walcott secured the gold, while Anderson Peters took silver, and Curtis Thompson claimed bronze. Sachin Yadav of India narrowly missed the podium, finishing fourth.

title: 'Another setback': Cong attacks PM over Pak-Saudi pact; flags nat'l security concerns
content: The Congress party has voiced strong criticism of Prime Minister Modi regarding the newly established defence pact between Pakistan and Saudi Arabia, citing it as a significant threat to India's security. The agreement, which formalizes long-standing security cooperation, pledges mutual support against external aggression.

title: Solar eclipse: Date, time, and where it will be visible in US, Canada, Australia
content: A partial solar eclipse will grace the skies on September 21, 2025, primarily visible from the Southern Hemisphere. Skywatchers in southern New Zealand and eastern Australia, including Sydney and Melbourne, will have prime viewing opportunities. Safety is paramount; certified eclipse glasses are essential for direct observation.

title: Iga Świątek Net Worth 2025: Titles, sponsors soar — fortune revealed
content: Iga Świątek, the Polish tennis star, boasts an estimated $30 million net worth in 2025, fueled by tournament wins and endorsements. Her career prize money exceeds $41 million, including a significant Wimbledon victory against Amanda Anisimova. Świątek's endorsement deals with brands like On Sportswear and Porsche contribute substantially to her earnings. Ranked World No.

title: Nvidia to invest $5 billion in Intel; firms to co-develop AI infrastructure and PCs
content: Nvidia is set to invest $5 billion in Intel, forging a partnership to develop AI infrastructure and PC products. Nvidia will purchase Intel stock, and Intel will design custom processors for Nvidia's data centers and integrate Nvidia tech into PC chips. This collaboration aims to boost Intel, which has faced financial struggles, while expanding Nvidia's reach in the AI market.

title: Strange! 'Nobody buys a ticket to see Virat Kohli ... ': Former World Cup winner says
content: Balvinder Singh Sandhu proposes that the BCCI should consider using specialist fielders in domestic cricket and the IPL to manage the workload of senior players like Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, and Jasprit Bumrah. He argues that excessive fielding puts unnecessary strain on these key players, potentially shortening their careers. "Why kill the goose that lays the golden egg?” he wrote in his Mid-Day column.

title: Indian-origin man held by ICE: In custody since July; all about Paramjit Singh's case
content: Paramjit Singh, a green card holder, has been detained by ICE after returning from India due to a decades-old minor infraction. Despite having a brain tumor and heart problems, his health is deteriorating in custody.

title: Maruti Suzuki cuts car prices: Brezza, Swift, Alto get cheaper; GST 2.0 savings
content: Maruti Suzuki has announced significant price reductions across its vehicle lineup, effective September 22, 2025, passing on GST 2.0 benefits to customers. Price cuts, reaching up to Rs 1.29 lakh, impact models like S-Presso, Alto K10, Swift, and Brezza. This move aims to stimulate demand during the festive season and strengthen Maruti Suzuki's market position.

title: IND A vs AUS A: Shreyas Iyer’s Test comeback dreams take a hit — falls for single digits
content: Shreyas Iyer's struggles continued as he scored only eight runs in the unofficial Test against Australia A, further jeopardizing his chances for a Test comeback. Australia A posted a formidable 532/6 declared, highlighted by centuries from Sam Konstas and Josh Phillippe. India A's innings saw contributions from Abhimanyu Easwaran and Sai Sudharsan, but Iyer's performance remained a concern.

title: 'I respect all religions': CJI on 'ask your deity' remark; all about Khajuraho case
content: Following social media criticism for his “go ask your deity” comment, CJI BR Gavai affirmed his respect for all religions. This came after a bench led by him dismissed a plea seeking reconstruction of a Lord Vishnu idol at the Javari Temple in Khajuraho, deeming it a “publicity interest litigation”.

title: 'Mobiles, software used': Rahul explains how Aland saw massive voter deletions
content: Rahul Gandhi presented evidence of mass voter deletions in Karnataka's Aland constituency, alleging a coordinated, software-driven operation targeting Congress voters before the 2023 elections. He highlighted instances of fraudulent deletion applications, unusual timings, and the use of mobile numbers from outside Karnataka. Gandhi asserted that these deletions were strategically focused on Congress-stronghold booths, indicating a deliberate attempt to disenfranchise voters.

title: Which 0-2 teams still have a shot at the playoffs? Barnwell ranks all 10 by turnaround likelihood
content: Can the Chiefs or Texans turn it around? Do the Bears have a chance in the NFC? Is the season already over for the Giants and Jets?

title: McLaughlin-Levrone dazzles in historic 400m win
content: Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone became the first woman in nearly 40 years to crack the 48-second barrier in the 400 meters, finishing in 47.78 in a historically fast race to claim gold at the world championships.

title: Sources: Kansas, ASU FB talking '26 London game
content: Kansas and Arizona State are in discussions to hold next season's game at Wembley Stadium in London, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Stewart to race against wife in '26 NHRA season
content: NASCAR Hall of Famer Tony Stewart will continue his drag-racing career in 2026 -- and he will compete against his wife, Leah Pruett.

title: UM gets donation for Testaverde, Torretta statues
content: The Miami Hurricanes will build on-campus statues of Heisman Trophy winners Vinny Testaverde and Gino Torretta, thanks to a $1.81 million donation.

title: MLB down period aims to ease amateur 'pressure'
content: MLB hopes that a new Amateur Recovery Period Policy, as ordered in a memo obtained by ESPN, will "alleviate the pressure on young players" hoping to play professional baseball.

title: NCAA removes spring transfer window for football
content: The NCAA voted to eliminate the spring transfer portal window but did not sign off on establishing Jan. 2-11 as the lone window for FBS and FCS players.

title: Mourinho returns to first coaching job at Benfica
content: Jose Mourinho has returned to Portuguese football as coach of Benfica less than three weeks after being sacked by Fenerbahce.

title: Johnson: I'm not giving 'trade secrets' to Brady
content: Ben Johnson isn't worried about divulging information that can be used against the Bears when he participates in production meetings with Tom Brady.

title: ♥️ Cardi B, Stefon Diggs expecting child
content: The Patriots wide receiver and Grammy Award-winning rapper have been spotted in public with each other since February.

title: How a Dodgers reliever became the unlikely catalyst for baseball's biggest labor battle
content: There are two words MLB and the MLBPA simply cannot agree on. Here's how it got this way and what it means for the next CBA.

title: Wetzel: WNBA's gold rush leaves Connecticut fans in the dust
content: The WNBA is repaying Connecticut fans for their loyalty by trying to move the Sun out of state, ESPN's Dan Wetzel writes.

title: Week 4 kickoff: Arch Manning leads list of QBs falling short, plus breakout players and top quotes
content: Ahead of Week 4, we take a look at big conference matchups, quarterbacks who have room to grow, plus quotes.

title: 'Until we win games ... it doesn't matter': Why the Dolphins are fixing a broken team culture
content: In 2024, accountability and tardiness issues with star players were common. Miami is trying to fix it.

title: Millions, MVP and marriage: 'There's more in life' for Bills QB Josh Allen
content: After an offseason of significant highs,  the QB shares a different perspective on football and its place in his life.

title: From 6 losing seasons to sneaky contenders: How the Dream rebuilt their franchise
content: Deal-making for the right players. A new coach. And a culture shift. Here's how Atlanta turned things around.

title: MLB Power Rankings: Where every team ranks with less than two weeks left
content: Some teams have already clinched postseason berths, while others are making one last push with 11 days to go. Where do they all stand on our second-to-last list?

content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

content: Takeaways on more than a dozen players, including whether you should be patient with a pair of rookies.

title: Reunion or revenge? Transfers facing their old teams a new part of the season
content: In the transfer era, playing former teams is commonplace. How each side approaches these games affects the game plan and the players.

title: 'Bragging rights for all eternity': An ode to the Iron Skillet rivalry
content: Looking back at the history of the SMU-TCU grudge match before its 104th, and potentially final, edition.

title: 'They're done building around him': Inside the tumultuous Kawhi Leonard era in Los Angeles
content: Just weeks after the Clippers shocked the NBA world by signing the 2019 NBA MVP, a feeling percolated across the organization: fear.

title: Why the champs and four other teams control the future of the NBA draft
content: Bobby Marks and Jeremy Woo break down the top five NBA teams with the most future first-round draft picks, from Oklahoma City to Utah.

title: Champions League talking points: Is this Arsenal's year? Which stars shone for their team?
content: Behold, the Chaaaaampiooooons! That sound you hear is our collective joy at the UCL's return. ESPN experts offer their thoughts on Matchday 1 so far.

title: Isak might be the new star, but Salah remains Liverpool's main man
content: Alexander Isak made his Liverpool debut, but it was Mo Salah that lifted the Reds over Atletico Madrid.

title: The race for the USMNT's No. 9 shirt is wide open
content: Striker has long been a problem area for the U.S. men's national team. Now, though, the Americans boast four forwards at the top of their game.

title: Will Gladbach's instability prove to be a blessing or a curse for Reyna?
content: Gio Reyna moved to Borussia Monchengladbach to help revive his career. The team already has a new coach.

title: No run game in Kansas City? Poor O-lines in Houston, Minnesota? Real-or-not ratings for every team
content: Which shocking early statistical trends have staying power, and which are a product of a small sample size?

title: What we're hearing: Latest on Aaron Rodgers, Bengals' plans without Joe Burrow
content: Our insiders have intel on Rodgers' first two games in Pittsburgh, Cincinnati's post-Burrow scramble and more.

title: Which NFL teams are rising -- and falling -- after two weeks? Here's our fresh 1-32 Power Rankings poll
content: It's time for new NFL Power Rankings after two weeks! We stacked the best teams and named the biggest QB takeaway for each roster.

title: Can the Giants afford to sit Jaxson Dart for the whole year? Here are the benefits
content: Dart's job is to sit and learn behind Russell Wilson. Can the Giants stay patient and let him develop?

title: What happens to a college football roster when a coach is fired in September?
content: UCLA and Virginia Tech fired their coaches Sunday after Week 3 of the college football season. What's next?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man City eye shock move for Man Utd's Mainoo
content: Manchester United midfielder Kobbie Mainoo is a transfer target for crosstown rivals Manchester City. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Way-Too-Early Grand Slam predictions for 2026
content: The majors are done for the year -- is it too early to forecast who will reign supreme in 2026? Never.

title: NBA Future Power Rankings: Is your favorite team built to last?
content: Where could the next three seasons take your favorite team? Our NBA insiders are mapping out the futures of all 30.

title: Fantasy basketball: Sleepers, breakouts and busts for 2025-26
content: Which fantasy basketball players are going to exceed expectations in 2025-26? Who will disappoint? Who is ready to take things to an elite level? Our experts list their picks.

title: Buy the dip: Thirteen players primed for bounce-back seasons
content: These fantasy hockey players underwhelmed last season, but could return to better production this year.

title: BJP engaging in communal politics instead of dealing with unemployment, inflation, poverty: Tejashwi
content: He blamed the Nitish Kumar government for the deteriorating law and order situation in the State, alleging that not a single day has passed without murders and other criminal incidents

title: ED attaches assets worth ₹696.21 crore in PACL case
content: It was alleged that fraudulent collective investment schemes were floated by PACL, through which the company and its associates deceitfully raised and misappropriated around ₹48,000 crore from investors

title: NCST forms panel to examine extra duties assigned to it 20 years ago
content: In August 2005, the Ministry of Tribal Affairs issued a notification assigning a list of eight additional duties to the mandate of the NCST, including suggesting measures to protect ownership of minor forest produce, protecting tribal communities from land alienation, and viable livelihood strategies

title: Watch: Rahul Gandhi accuses EC of vote chori: Explained
content: Rahul Gandhi accused the Election Commission of shielding those behind voter deletions in Karnataka’s Aland constituency. He highlighted deleted votes, suspicious forms, and a centralised operation targeting Congress supporters.

title: Army scales up drone induction, aims to make every soldier a drone operator
content: By institutionalising training and aligning force structures, Army is ensuring that the soldier of tomorrow will carry not just a weapon, but also an eagle — a drone that extends his vision, reach, and power on the battlefield

title: Supreme Court adjourns plea on horizontal reservation for transgender doctors in NEET-PG admissions
content: The plea contends that the absence of horizontal reservation contravenes the Supreme Court’s NALSA ruling, which mandated affirmative action for transgender persons in education and public employment

title: Don’t hike liquor prices frequently, Satheesan tells State govt.
content: Hiking the price of liquor will not bring down consumption and will only increase it, says Leader of the Opposition in the Assembly

title: EPFO launches ‘Passbook Lite’ for easier access to PF balance, other details
content: The EPFO also enabled online access to ‘Annexure K’ (Transfer Certificate) for PF transfer transparency

title: Adapt innovatively to climate change: IMD Director General
content: ‘Research should be intensified towards crop varieties that can withstand climate changes and give high quality and good yields’

title: Programme to train public in CPR to be launched on World Heart Day
content: The Health department will prepare an action plan and modern mannequins would be used to demonstrate CPR

title: Washrooms in fuel outlets near NHs must remain open to public during working hours, says Kerala HC
content: Display boards announcing the availability of washrooms and drinking water must be placed at the entrance of the outlets, says the court

title: Reduce, Reuse and Recycle Centres to be set up at all ward secretariat offices in Vijayawada
content: People can bring used steel utensils, clothes, books, papers, slippers, shoes, electronic equipment, and other materials to their nearest RRR centre, says VMC Commissioner

title: Centre driving reforms to modernise cantonments, promote ease of living and doing business: Rajnath Singh
content: The Directorate General of Defence Estates manages 18 lakh acres of defence land and 61 cantonments across India; new laws will bring citizen-friendly, transparent governance to cantonments, Defence Minister says

title: Police issue warning against fake QR codes in public places in Kozhikode
content: Attempts to steal private data and bank records are suspected through fake QR codes placed in the name of promotional offers, job opportunities, and free Wi-FI connections

title: Potential for EU tie-ups with Kerala in multiple sectors: EU Ambassador to India
content: Fisheries Minister Saji Cherian holds discussions with EU delegation on the first day of the Kerala-EU Blue Economy Conclave on the potential of Kerala’s coastal and fisheries sector

title: Aland episode isn’t local mischief, but a window into larger conspiracy: CM
content: The truth is simple: BJP attempts ‘vote chori’, and the Election Commission is blocking the investigation. By refusing to share data, the ECI is protecting the guilty instead of protecting democracy, alleges Siddaramaiah

title: BRS questions TG Govt.’s silence on Karnataka’s decision to go for Almatti dam height increase
content: Party leader B. Vinod Kumar says that Karnataka’s move is detrimental to the interests of Krishna Basin areas in Telangana

title: A.P. govt. brings back safely 361 Telugu pilgrims from Nepal in week-long rescue mission
content: Minister Nara Lokesh personally monitors the entire operation; the last batch of 86 stranded at Manasarovar lake return from the strife-torn nation by a special flight and reach their homes in Vizag, Vijayawada, Tirupati and other places

title: Mayor inaugurates two health centres
content: Services of a doctor and paramedical staff will be available at the health centres at Chanthavila and Kattayikkonam from 2 p.m. to 8 p.m.

title: Swachhotsav 2025 begins at Central University in Kalaburagi
content: The fortnight-long programme will feature various cleanliness and awareness activities till October 2

title: PM Modi to review National Maritime Heritage Complex at Lothal
content: He will also inspect the works completed so far and hold a detailed review meeting with officials regarding the ongoing projects at the site on September 20

title: Govt. appoints chairpersons for various temple boards in Andhra Pradesh
content: The government also appoints presidents for various Local Advisory Committees of the Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams

title: Delegation of European ambassadors, senior diplomats visits Vizhinjam port
content: Officials given a detailed overview of the port’s strategic capabilities and initiatives. Major investments and future projects were highlighted

title: Remorse is not enough, say Janu, Geethanandan
content: Tribespeople will never forgive A.K. Antony or those who justified the police action during the Muthanga land agitation in 2003, says Janu

title: All set for Veerashaiva Lingayat Ekta Samavesh in Hubballi today
content: Thousands of people are expected to head to the city for the convention at the Nehru Stadium to send a message of Veerashaiva Lingayat unity

title: Forest, Wildlife Bills referred to Subject Committee
content: While the Opposition expresses support for the intent behind the latter legislation that seeks to bolster the State’s efforts in mitigating human-wildlife conflicts, they dismiss it as an “election stunt”, given its introduction just months ahead of the local body elections

title: The Hindu to organise career seminar in Guntur on September 20
content: The programme aims to guide students of engineering and degree streams on career prospects in management and sciences and pursuing PG studies

title: Prathapan files private complaint alleging Suresh Gopi, kin illegally voted in Thrissur
content: He accuses Union Minister Suresh Gopi, his brother, Subhash Gopi, and their family members of illegally enrolling and casting votes at Mukkattukara booth in Thrissur in the 2024  Lok Sabha elections

title: A.P. Assembly passes resolution in support of GST rate cut
content: Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu says the tax rate rationalisation by the Centre is a bold and transformative reform which will give a big boost to the economy

title: Protest in Ongole over pending fee reimbursement
content: PDSU State vice-president L. Rajasekhar demanded the government to immediately release the pending fee reimbursement dues of ₹4,200 crore and to stop the privatisation of medical colleges in the state

title: Kerala HC extends suspension of toll collection at Paliyekkara plaza in Thrissur
content: A decision on resuming toll collection will be taken after checking the condition of the highway, including that of service roads through which vehicles are being diverted

title: A.P.’s solar power generation capacity stands at 5,006 MW, says Energy Minister Gottipati Ravi Kumar
content: Target is to increase it to 78.50 GWp under the A.P. Integrated Clean Energy Policy-2024, the Minister tells Legislative Assembly

content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Close call: AI Express flight makes emergency landing; suspected bird hit

title: 'Can't be on whims': Delhi HC raps Centre over delay in Kejriwal house allotment
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: US citizenship: Naturalisation test to be more rigorous - what are the changes
content: the Indian diaspora is the largest in the world; through her articles she demystifies the immigration-policy related developments in select countries for outbound students, job aspirants and employees . she also analyses the impact of Income-tax and GST related developments for individuals and business entities .

title: 'Close To India... Sanctioned Them': Amid Bonhomie, Trump's Mixed Messaging
content: Attempting to burnish his credentials as a solver of conflicts, US President Donald Trump said he had imposed "sanctions" on India to help end the war between Russia and Ukraine while simultaneously stating he is very close to New Delhi and PM Modi.

title: Faridabad Student Kidnapped, Thrashed For "Not Accepting" Instagram Request: Cops
content: Police have filed an FIR against three persons here for allegedly kidnapping and beating an Engineering student for "not accepting" the friend request of a woman on Instagram.

title: "Can't Be On Whims": Court To Centre On Procedure To Allot Bungalow To Kejriwal
content: Allotment of residential accommodation cannot be based purely on whims of the authorities, the Delhi High Court said in a plea filed by Aam Aadmi Party seeking a bungalow for its national convener and former chief minister Arvind Kejriwal

title: Vatican Not Ready To Declare War In Gaza A Genocide: Pope Leo XIV
content: The Holy See is not ready to declare Israel's campaign in Gaza genocide, Pope Leo XIV said in an interview given in July but published Thursday.

title: "No One Above Law": Court Orders Making Rules For Rallies By Political Parties
content: The Madras High Court on Wednesday directed the Tamil Nadu government to frame uniform guidelines applicable to all political parties for granting permission to hold rallies and public meetings.

title: High Court Roadblock For Kurmi Agitation In Bengal
content: The Calcutta High Court has declared the Kurmi community's plan for rail and road blockade on September 20 unconstitutional and illegal. The agitation was called to press the community's demand for Scheduled Tribe status.

title: Trump's UK State Visit Turns To Politics After Regal Welcome
content: Prime Minister Keir Starmer, on Thursday, welcomed Donald Trump to his country home of Chequers for talks on difficult issues, including trade, Ukraine, and Gaza, after the US president hailed his second state visit to the UK as the "highest honour".

title: Days After Violent Nepal Protests, Former PM Oli Moves Into Private House
content: Deposed prime minister K P Sharma Oli has moved from the army barracks to a private place, after spending nine days under the Nepalese Army security.

title: EU Unveils 'New Strategic Agenda' To Expand Ties With India
content: The European Union (EU) on Wednesday unveiled a new strategic agenda to significantly ramp up its engagement with India in a range of key areas such as defence, trade and energy, and to jointly tackle major global challenges.

title: 'Must Look Trade Deals With India To Reduce US Dependency': EU Chief
content: The European Union must look to trade deals with countries like India to reduce dependencies, with higher US import tariffs pushing the bloc to diversify its ties, President Ursula von der Leyen said

title: CBI Chargesheets Anil Ambani, Rana Kapoor In Rs 2,796 Crore Corruption Case
content: The CBI filed a chargesheet on Thursday against Anil Ambani and others over alleged fraudulent transactions causing a loss of Rs 2,796 crore to the bank, officials said.

title: 'Taking Over The World': Trump Says He Hopes AI Bosses Know What They're Doing
content: US President Donald Trump said on Thursday that artificial intelligence was taking over the world and he hoped tech bosses knew what they were doing, because he didn't.

title: Manual Scavenging Spotted Outside Supreme Court, Delhi Government Gets Steep Fine
content: The Delhi Public Works Department has been fined Rs 5 lakh by the Supreme Court after its labourers were found cleaning sewers outside the court building manually -- a process that is banned in view of the risks it poses to workers.

title: "Hindenburg Claims Were Baseless": Gautam Adani After SEBI Clean Chit
content: Welcoming SEBI's clean chit in the allegations made by short seller Hindenburg Research, Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani has said it reinforces what the group has always maintained - that the claims were baseless.

title: 'Putin Let Me Down': Trump Admits Thinking Ukraine War Was "Easy To Solve"
content: Donald Trump claimed that his Russian counterpart let him down during the process of solving the Ukraine war. Keir Starmer also criticised Putin and said that he showed his "true face" with the biggest attack on Ukraine.

title: Shared All Information: Karnataka Poll Officer After Rahul Gandhi Allegations
content: The office of the Karnataka Chief Electoral Officer (CEO) on Thursday said all available information with the Election Commission of India (ECI), regarding alleged attempts to delete 6,018 votes in the state's Aland constituency.

title: Ukrainian Drones Strike Russian Oil Refinery, Petrochemical Complex
content: Ukraine said on Thursday that its drones had struck a major oil processing and petrochemical complex and an oil refinery in Russia, part of an intensifying campaign to disrupt Moscow's oil and gas sector.

title: France's Macron To Offer 'Scientific Evidence' To Prove His Wife Is A Woman
content: French President Emmanuel Macron and his wife Brigitte plan to present "photographic and scientific evidence" to prove that France's first lady is not a transgender woman after suing the United States' far-right influencer Candace Owens

title: Speed, Precision, Low Cost: Israel To Soon Deploy "Game-Changer" Iron Beam
content: Israel's ground-based high-power laser defence system Iron Beam will be deployed by the end this year, reports claimed at a time the country's war with Hamas shows no signs of abatement.

title: Minor Raped By 2 Men She Met Through Social Media In Gurugram: Cops
content: A class 11 student was allegedly kidnapped and gang-raped by two men who she met on social media, police said on Thursday.

title: Inside Seth Rollins' 'injury,' the biggest deception in WWE history
content: CM Punk and seth Rollins clash at Wrestlepalooza live on the ESPN App . rollins paused to add to the drama as he made his exit . he said: "when you hear the music of the guy who's got the Money in the Bank briefcase, your immediate reaction is, ' Here comes the cash-in'

title: What MLB aces look like in 2025 compared to past decades
content: no pitcher has more than one nine-inning complete game this season . one hundred pitches is now viewed as the top limit for a pitch count . the list goes on, with pitchers rarely exceeding 110 . in 1985, 20-year-old right-hander Dwight Gooden went 24-4 with 1.53 ERA .

title: Best bets: Take the points with Arizona State at Baylor?
